sentences: Ta pead pilgu andma sellele asjale.
context: In Estonian, 'pilgu' is the partitive form of the word 'pilk', which means a glance or look. The partitive case in Estonian is often used to indicate the object that receives an action, so here it means 'a glance' or 'the act of looking'. It's commonly used when referring to giving someone a look or receiving one.
